title: maths esa
content:
hi guys. i am a first sem student in the physics cycle. i made a fool of myself today ig. 

as soon as i saw the maths esa paper, i started crying and i sort of went blank (idk why) and so i did a really poor job on the esa.

now i'm worried that i'll do the same in all other subjects and effectively ruin my gpa and essentially get myself fucked in the future sems.

for context, i was aiming for an sgpa of 9+ (lmao) but now im scared it will barely cross 8-8.5 sgpa.

is there any coming back from this? also, tips to manage anxiety before exams would be massively appreciated. tysm guys.

The math exam is done, and you can‚Äôt change that now. What you can do is focus on your other subjects to make up for it.

If you find yourself blanking out in an exam again, don‚Äôt panic. Skip the question, find the easiest one, and start there. Eventually, you‚Äôll get into a flow. The key is to keep moving instead of freezing.

I usually don‚Äôt study an hour or so before an exam, which helps me manage my anxiety. Instead, I chill, listen to music, or watch something on YouTube. A clear mind is always better than an overloaded one.

Don't be too hard on yourself; it's only your first ESA. 

I went through the same thing‚ÄîI'd study everything, but fear would make me go completely blank during the exam. This happened to me a lot in my first semester, which probably explains why my Semester 1 sgpa the lowest I‚Äôve ever had. Somehow, as I got more familiar with the exam patterns here and shifted my focus away from an obsessive concern with grades, I started to do so much better.

I'll ask you one very important question, did you have 8+ hrs of sleep? If not, your mind goes blank and you start panicking in the exam. Happened to me multiple times. And chill, it's just the first exam. Almost 40% failed the MA1 esa in my batch lol because of online classes and 8.5 cgpa is pretty good. Don't be too hard on yourself this is literally sem 1 lol. You'll have time to worry abt cgpa later. Just focus on having fun and making the best of your clg life in first year
no i did not :( i see a good chunk of seniors say this is the scoring year so if i fumble my bag here then it will cause a lot of regret..

Stop stressing too much fam. If you have 8+ cgpa, you'll be shortlisted for like 95% of companies. After that, your cgpa won't even matter. It'll matter if you want to go for masters tho but you have 8 semesters. Sem 5 and 6 are usually the scoring sems actually since the subjects get easier and you can choose the electives you want. I have frnds with <6 cgpa who have 10+ lpa jobs and people with 8+ cgpa who didn't get a single offer. Everyone stresses about cgpa in the first year but as long as you consistently study, you'll be fine. Cgpa isn't everything. And get proper sleep before the exams lol or so many days of studying will get wasted because you can't function properly. Been there.
Don't mess up first year. It will affect overall GPA, if you do.
yes that is my main concern :(

You still have time. Don't screw up second sem...and you can take your backlog (if you incurred it) some other time. A word of advice try and not get below C grade in any other subject if you want to maintain your gpa to a higher bracket.
